Jazz Client Release 4.0.4

SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.ibm.team.scm.client
Interface IConfiguration

public interface IConfiguration

Represents a configuration of versionable items, scoped by Component.

Configurations are large objects that live server-side in the repository. A typical configuration is much like the file system on your machine's hard drives: an extensive tree (forest) of files. Just an you operate on the individual files in the context of the file system, the client operates on versionable items in the context of a configuration. And while you may ship individual or small collections of files back and forth between disk and memory, there's no need to ship the entire file systems back and forth in order to interact with it. The file system stay put. Likewise with configurations. They stay put, in the repository. All you ever need an IConfiguration for is to provide context. Furthermore, there are no operations that overtly change configurations. Workspaces are the foundries where all configurations are cast.

Configurations are intended to be used by multi-threaded clients. Unless noted, the methods on IConfiguration can be safely called from multiple threads concurrently without risk of corruption.

Since:
0.5

Method Detail

teamRepository

ITeamRepository teamRepository()
Returns the repository associated with this configuration. The client need not be logged in to the repository.

Returns:
the repository, which is never null

isLive

boolean isLive()
Returns whether this configuration is "live". Live configurations may change over time, which may affect the results they return for their methods. Fixed configurations are constant and do not change their answers over time. Note that the various Collection objects returned by the methods do not change under foot for live configuration; it's just that the collections you get back next time may contain different elements.

The configuration of a workspace is always live; conversely, the configuration of a baseline is never live.

Design note: The live flag allows the client to programmatically discover whether information retrieved from a configuration would be cacheable by the client.

Returns:
true if this configuration is live, and false if fixed

component

IComponentHandle component()
Returns a handle to the component that is scoping this configuration.

Returns:
The handle to the component. Never null.

isAvailable

boolean isAvailable(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
Returns whether this configuration is available.

A configuration may be unavailable for any number of reasons, including:

  • The repository is not logged in to.

Parameters:
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
true if this configuration is available, and false if it is unavailable for any reason

rootFolderHandle

IFolderHandle rootFolderHandle(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                               throws TeamRepositoryException
Retrieves the handle of the root folder in this single-component configuration. The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if the client is not logged in to the repository, if this configuration is not associated with a component or the configuration is unavailable for any other reason.

Note: The root of a single-component configuration is always the component's root folder. Below the root folder are files, folders, and other versionable item types which are supplied by server/repository extensions. The root folder is always present; it is created automatically and cannot be deleted.

Parameters:
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the handle of the root folder for this configuration's; never null.
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

childEntries

java.util.Map childEntries(IFolderHandle folderHandle,
                           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                           throws TeamRepositoryException
Retrieves the names and item handles for the children of the given folder in this configuration. It is assumed that the referenced folderHandle is contained within the component that scopes this configuration.

The operation fails if the client is not logged in to the repository, the configuration is unavailable, or the item is not present in this configuration.

Parameters:
folderHandle - the folder to examine; must not be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a possibly empty map of name-item entries (key type: String, value type: IVersionableHandle); unmodifiable and fixed; the entries all have distinct non-null names; the entries all have distinct non-null item ids and include state ids; the order of the entries is unspecified and may vary from call to call; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
ItemNotFoundException - if the item is absent from the configuration
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any reason

Throws:

childEntries

java.util.List childEntries(java.util.List folderHandles,
                            org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                            throws TeamRepositoryException
Retrieves the names and item handles for the children of the given folders in this configuration. It is assumed that the referenced folderHandles are contained within the component that scopes this configuration.

The operation fails if the client is not logged in to the repository, or the configuration is unavailable.

Parameters:
folderHandles - the folders to examine; must not be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a possibly empty list of name-item maps (element type: Map); unmodifiable and fixed; the maps all have distinct non-null names; the entries all have distinct non-null item ids and include state ids; the order of the maps corresponds to the order of the parents in the folderHandles list; and entry may be null to indicate the corresponding folder is not present in the configuration; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
ItemNotFoundException - if the item is absent from the configuration
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any reason

locateAncestors

java.util.List locateAncestors(java.util.List versionableHandles,
                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                               throws TeamRepositoryException
For each specified item, retrieves the sequence of name-item pairs that leads to that item in the configuration starting at a root folder. It is assumed that the reference versions can be found in the component that scopes this configuration.

This information could be turned into a path by combining the names from each folder entry in sequence. The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if the client is not logged in to the repository.

There can be at most one path to any particular versionable item in a configuration. A folder namespace is a strict tree with a single root for each component; there is no equivalent of Unix-style hard links.

Parameters:
versionableHandles - a list of IVersionableHandle; neither the list nor its entries can be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a list of ancestor reports (element type: IAncestorReport) paralleling versionableItems in the order given; each ancestor report is the sequence of folder entries that leads from a root folder to the specified item; the first element corresponds to a root folder and the last element corresponds to the versionable item itself; an empty sequence means the item is not present in this configuration; the first name-item pair (only) will have a null name because root folders are not cataloged in any folder themselves; all item handles within the ancestor report carry state ids; unmodifiable and fixed; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

determineAncestorsInHistory

java.util.List determineAncestorsInHistory(java.util.List versionableHandles,
                                           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                           throws TeamRepositoryException
For each specified item, retrieves the sequence of name-item pairs that leads to that item in the configuration starting at a root folder. If the item is not in the configuration, return a similar report which represents an estimate of what this configuration last knew the path as.

This information could be turned into a path by combining the names from each folder entry in sequence. The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if the client is not logged in to the repository.

There can be at most one path to any particular versionable item in a configuration. A folder namespace is a strict tree with a single root for each component; there is no equivalent of Unix-style hard links.

Parameters:
versionableHandles - a list of IVersionableHandle; neither the list nor its entries can be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a list of ancestor reports (element type: IAncestorReport) paralleling versionableItems in the order given; each ancestor report is the sequence of folder entries that leads from a root folder to the specified item; the first element corresponds to a root folder and the last element corresponds to the versionable item itself; an empty sequence means the item was never present in the history of this component, or that the item may be in history, but has never made it successfully into the configuration due to it being in conflict; the first name-item pair (only) will have a null name because root folders are not cataloged in any folder themselves; all item handles within the ancestor report carry state ids; unmodifiable and fixed; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

resolvePath

IVersionableHandle resolvePath(IFolderHandle folderHandle,
                               java.lang.String[] nameSegments,
                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                               throws TeamRepositoryException
Retrieves a handle for the versionable item cataloged at the specified path relative to the specified folder. It is assumed that the referenced folderHandle can be found in the component that scopes this configuration.

Each segment of the path represents a folder item except the final segment, which can catalog any versionable item. Returns null if there is no item at the given path. If nameSegments is empty, the method returns folderHandle provided it is present in the configuration, and null if the folder is absent. The operation fails by throwing NotLoggedInException if the client is not logged in to the repository.

Parameters:
folderHandle - the folder within which to resolve the path; must not be null
nameSegments - the possibly empty sequence of name segments; each entry must be a non-null string of between 1 and 250 characters; must not be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the versionable item cataloged at the path, or null if the path cannot be resolved
Throws:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

partialRootFolder

IFolder partialRootFolder(java.util.Collection requiredProperties,
                          org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                          throws TeamRepositoryException
Retrieves the root folder in this single-component configuration. The operation fails by throwing NotLoggedInException if the client is not logged in to the repository, if this configuration is not associated with a component, or the configuration is unavailable for other reason.

Note: The root of a single-component configuration is always the component's root folder. Below the root folder are files, folders, and other versionable item types such as requirements which are supplied by server/repository extensions. The root folder is always present; it is created automatically and cannot be deleted.

Parameters:
requiredProperties - the list of names of item properties (element type: String); the strings must be valid property names for the item type of itemHandle; duplicate property names are tolerated; null means use the defaults for the item type
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the root folder; never null
Throws:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

fetchPartialItem

IVersionable fetchPartialItem(IVersionableHandle versionableItem,
                              java.util.Collection requiredProperties,
                              org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                              throws TeamRepositoryException
Finds and retrieves the given versionable item in this configuration. It is assumed that the referenced version can be found in the component that scopes this configuration.

The operation fails if the client is not logged in to the repository, the configuration is unavailable, or the item is not present in this configuration.

This convenience method is mostly equivalent to IConfiguration.fetchCompleteItems(List, IProgressMonitor) for a single item, except that it throws a TeamRepositoryException if the item is not present from the configuration.

Parameters:
versionableItem - a versionable item handle; must not be null
requiredProperties - the list of names of item properties (element type: String); the strings must be valid property names for the item type of itemHandle; duplicate property names are tolerated; null means use the defaults for the item type
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the versionable item; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
ItemNotFoundException - if the item is absent from the configuration
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any reason

fetchPartialItems

java.util.List fetchPartialItems(java.util.List versionableItems,
                                 java.util.Collection requiredProperties,
                                 org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                 throws TeamRepositoryException
Finds and retrieves the given versionable items in this configuration. It is assumed that these items can be found within the component that scopes this configuration.

The result is a flat list of versionable states that includes elements corresponding to each of the given items, in the same order. Items absent from the configuration are indicated by null in the corresponding position in the result. The operation fails if the client is not logged in to the repository, or the configuration is unavailable for any other reason.

Parameters:
versionableItems - a list of versionable item(element type: IVersionableHandle); must not be null
requiredProperties - the list of names of item properties (element type: String); the strings must be valid property names for the item type of itemHandle; duplicate property names are tolerated; null means use the defaults for the item type
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the list of the states of the versionable items (element type: IVersionableor null) in the same order as versionableItems, with null elements indicating corresponding items absent from the configuration (element type: Versionable; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

                           throws TeamRepositoryException
Retrieves the root folder in this single-component configuration. The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if the client is not logged in to the repository, if this configuration is not associated with a component, or the configuration is unavailable for other reason.

Note: The root of a single-component configuration is always the component's root folder. Below the root folder are files, folders, and other versionable item types such as requirements which are supplied by server/repository extensions. The root folder is always present; it is created automatically and cannot be deleted.

Parameters:
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the root folder; never null
Throws:

                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                               throws TeamRepositoryException
Finds and retrieves the given versionable item in this configuration. It is assumed that the referenced version can be found in the component that scopes this configuration.

The operation fails if the client is not logged in to the repository, the configuration is unavailable, or the item is not present in this configuration.

This convenience method is mostly equivalent to IConfiguration.fetchCompleteItems(List, IProgressMonitor)for a single item, except that it throws a ItemNotFoundException if the item is not present from the configuration.

Parameters:
versionableItem - a versionable item handle; must not be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the versionable item; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
ItemNotFoundException - if the item is absent from the configuration
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any reason

fetchCompleteItems

java.util.List fetchCompleteItems(java.util.List versionableItems,
                                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                  throws TeamRepositoryException
Finds and retrieves the given versionable items in this configuration. It is assumed that these items can be found within the component that scopes this configuration.

The result is a flat list of versionable states that includes elements corresponding to each of the given items, in the same order. Items absent from the configuration are indicated by null in the corresponding position in the result. The operation fails if the client is not logged in to the repository, or the configuration is unavailable for any other reason.

Parameters:
versionableItems - a list of versionable item(element type: IVersionableHandle); must not be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the list of the states of the versionable items (element type: IVersionableor null) in the same order as versionableItems, with null elements indicating corresponding items absent from the configuration (element type: Versionable; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

fetchAncestorsByName

java.util.List fetchAncestorsByName(java.lang.String exactVersionableName,
                                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                    throws TeamRepositoryException
Finds and retrieves versionable items in this configuration whose names match the input criteria.

The result is a list of ancestor reports which match the versionable name. The operation fails if the client is not logged in to the repository, or the configuration is unavailable for any other reason.

Parameters:
exactVersionableName - a non-null, non-empty name for the versionable
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the list of ancestor reports according to states of the versionable items (element type: IAncestorReportor null) which match the criteria; never null, but perhaps empty.
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
See Also:
IVersionable.getName()
